intro: Ophiorrhiza vietnamensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese mistflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and delicate, hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Ophiorrhiza vietnamensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
